newsitem.title: USA: Novartis unit plans to sell 14 OTC drugs.
newsitem.headline: Novartis unit plans to sell 14 OTC drugs.

text.p: Novartis AG's Novartis Consumer Health Inc said on Monday it planned to sell 14 over-the-counter pharmaceutical products in its portfolio, as part of a plan to streamline its product portfolio.

The 14 brands included cold and allergy and nutritional products Allerest, Nostrilla, Privine, Sinarest and Vitron-C. The company also said it planned to sell topical products Americaine, Caldecort, Caldesene, Eucalyptamint and Ting, and gastrointestinal products Bacid, Fiberall and Kondremul.
The company also said it planned to sell Acutrim, its diet product.

"A product rationalization was conducted that concluded that the sale of these products was needed to meet our short-term and long-term business needs," Novartis Consumer Health President Fred Huser said.
The company said Seawoulfe Partners Ltd was assisting it with the sale.
